{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3341065,"name":"","username":"Ishan1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-23T00:54:39.901Z","cooked":"

Hello,

We are currently having issues with our laserCAN sensors. Some symptoms are: not being able to connect to the sensor while connected to the roborio via usb using GrappleHook, and after lots of fighting with it and getting values, the sensor is very inconsistent in getting the input from the note and stopping the note from hitting the flywheel. GrappleHook is able to read the values occasionally, we don’t really understand why this happens.

Here is our ShooterSubsystem where we create and use the laserCAN:
ShooterSubsystem.java (6.9 KB)

Thanks.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-23T00:54:39.901Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":83,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":447.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459767,"topic_slug":"lasercan-not-connecting-through-grapplehook-and-not-reading-input","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"/uploads/short-url/xQIM7laAZDh3JhocafzUlreQ0tk.java","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56221,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4829 | Director of Software"},"post_url":"/t/lasercan-not-connecting-through-grapplehook-and-not-reading-input/459767/1","custom_user_title":"4829 | Director of Software","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3341076,"name":"Jaci","username":"Jaci","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaci/{size}/8002_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-23T01:12:27.481Z","cooked":"

Hi,

The immediate thing that comes to mind is making sure your stub length is short if you’re branching off the main CAN bus for use with the LaserCAN, and using a termination resistor if this is the case. Is your CAN bus wired in series all the way down, or are you branching off? Aside from that, are all your electrical connections sound and your CAN bus utilisation not capping out?

Having two LaserCANs using the same ID could also cause you to get fighting values, but I wouldn’t expect that to make it hard to detect the sensor at all.

Best,
Jaci

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-23T01:12:27.481Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":153,"readers_count":152,"score":90.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459767,"topic_slug":"lasercan-not-connecting-through-grapplehook-and-not-reading-input","display_username":"Jaci","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Grapple | FRC 10350"},"post_url":"/t/lasercan-not-connecting-through-grapplehook-and-not-reading-input/459767/2","custom_user_title":"Grapple | FRC 10350","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341197,"name":"Gordon Walsh","username":"GordonW","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-23T04:28:18.611Z","cooked":"
Jaci:

and using a termination resistor if this is the case

Just checking on this bit (and hopefully not starting another CAN topology mega-thread): Is this suggesting to add an additional 120 Ohm at the CAN node at the end of an in-spec (<12" IIRC) stub off of the main bus? My understanding was that the bus should have exactly two 120 Ohm resistors regardless of any topology variances, unless you were actually verifying the timings and impedances of your specific setup/topology (which would be above my pay grade).

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-23T04:28:18.611Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":33.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":459767,"topic_slug":"lasercan-not-connecting-through-grapplehook-and-not-reading-input","display_username":"Gordon Walsh","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26202,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5827 Mentor | he/him/his"},"post_url":"/t/lasercan-not-connecting-through-grapplehook-and-not-reading-input/459767/3","custom_user_title":"5827 Mentor | he/him/his","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341214,"name":"Jaci","username":"Jaci","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaci/{size}/8002_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-23T06:33:18.682Z","cooked":"

Bad wording on my part - if your stubs are short, you can omit the termination resistor on the stub only. For impedance matching and reflection rejection reasons, you still need a termination resistor on each end of the bus regardless of how long the total bus length is.

The solution you are suggesting applies to a star topology for the CAN bus correct? Thats what you mean by stubs (the pieces branching off the main CAN line)? Our team wires our entire CAN bus in series. I do not believe that our CAN bus utilization is capping out and we only have one laserCAN.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T17:46:38.593Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":25.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459767,"topic_slug":"lasercan-not-connecting-through-grapplehook-and-not-reading-input","display_username":"Jack brannon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24335,"username":"Jaci","name":"Jaci","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaci/{size}/8002_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/lasercan-not-connecting-through-grapplehook-and-not-reading-input/459767/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345085,"name":"Jaci","username":"Jaci","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaci/{size}/8002_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T10:53:10.974Z","cooked":"

It applies to any CAN bus topology, since every topology technically have stubs, it’s just most of them are short enough that they’re just on the PCB. If you’re still having issues, and you have more than one LaserCAN, have you tried using a different LaserCAN on the bus?

Either way, make sure your firmware is up to date. Please also send me a list of all the devices on your bus (just make / model is sufficient) and I’ll investigate
